title: This is what 53 looks like: Mother-of-two reveals daily probiotics and yoga keeps her youthful
text:
Julie Bailey lives in Harpenden, Herts, with her husband, Simon. They have two children, George, 26, and Kate, 23. She is a yoga teacher.

LIFE-LONG PROBIOTICS

When I was 30, I was feeling sluggish and run down, so I went to see a nutritionist. She recommended Garden of Life Primal Defense Probiotic Formula supplements (£39.78, amazon.co.uk). I’ve been taking them every day since. They use a blend of 12 probiotics, to help maintain a healthy immune system. It’s expensive, but if I miss a day, the symptoms come back and I feel poorly again.

LONG HAIR REGIME

My hair is the longest it’s ever been. I put it down to the Solgar Skin, Nails and Hair tablets I take daily (£12.99, holland andbarrett.com). It’s a strengthening elixir of vitamin C, zinc and copper. I’ve also switched to a Dyson Supersonic hair dryer (£299.99, dyson.co.uk). It keeps the hair in better condition, as it adapts the temperature if it gets too hot.

Julie Bailey, 53, (pictured) from Harpenden, Herts, revealed how a combination of natural skincare treatments and yoga helps to keep her youthful

NATURAL SKINCARE

I’ve noticed my skin has really dropped with age — but I still want to go down a natural route. So, instead of Botox, I get a CACI non-surgical ‘face lift’ every month (£51.50, lavenderandstonebeauty rooms.co.uk). It’s non-invasive and uses electrical impulses to lift and tone the muscles. I also swear by de Mamiel Intense Nurture Antioxidant Elixir (£88, demamiel.com), which uses natural enzymes to create an instant glow.

CBD SLEEP SAVIOUR

I’ve struggled to sleep well since I hit the menopause. However, Cupid CBD Peppermint Oil (£35, cubidcbd.com) has really helped. I add a couple of drops to a cup of mint tea before bed. My friend recommended it — and it’s made such a difference. I also write down my worries so as to clear my head.

MIDLIFE YOGA

In my late 30s I took up yoga, yet I didn’t train as an instructor until I was 50. Before this, I worked in accounting. You really can start yoga at any age and don’t need to be super flexible. I love Vinyasa yoga, where the movements flow into each other, using every part of the body. It’s good for beginners. I do it for ten to 30 minutes every day. Yoga has changed my life: I am stronger, more patient and caring because of it.

Do you look good for your age? Reveal your secrets to inspire@dailymail.co.uk
description: Julie Bailey, 53, who lives in Harpenden, Herts, with her husband, Simon, revealed how she maintains her ageless appearance. The mother-of-two follows a natural skincare regime.
authors: Florence Scordoulis For The Daily Mail
